titles.title: For God So Loved The World

authors.author: Eliza E. Hewitt J. Lincoln Hall

verse.name: c1
verse.lines: For God so loved the world, newline That He gave His only begotten Son, newline That whosoever believeth in Him, newline Whosoever believeth in Him, newline Should not perish should not perish, newline But have everlasting life.

verse.name: v1
verse.lines: A story sweet and wondrous, newline Like heavenly music swells. newline In chimings clear to all who will hear, newline Ring out the gospel bells.

verse.name: v2
verse.lines: When, grieving brokenhearted, newline Because of sin and shame, newline We find a joy earth cannot destroy, newline Believing on His name.

verse.name: v3
verse.lines: This love, beyond all measure, newline Of earth or sea or sky, newline Could only show its full overflow, newline When Jesus came to die.

verse.name: v4
verse.lines: Come, brother come to Jesus, newline His word was meant for you; newline His grace receive, His promise believe, newline And sing His praise anew.
